page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT,DUNTISBOURNE AREA
page.content: In this area there was a 12% unemployment rate in 1981,although the people today say there are very few villagers without jobs.A quarter of the total population are retired so many were seen gardening or doing odd jobs around the village.18% are under 16 and would be attending local Junior or Secondary schools.There was little work to be found in the immediate area and pupils were told that there are no longer any of the old craftsmen in the villages.Most working inhabitants go elsewhere-Cheltenham,Gloucester and Cirencester,even up to London.There is a stable in Winstone where some young people can work as grooms and there is also farmwork but the number employed on farms is reducing.
